It's on the CW...

Step One, and this is important: **AVOID MATTEL AT ALL COSTS**
Now that we've got that outta the way...
If you want affordable action figures, you should check out Marvel Legends and DC Icons.
DC Icons have their detractors but the figures are miles better than the garbage Mattel pisses out. You can find these on Amazon, and comic shops.
Marvel Legends are basically everywhere.
If you wanna go a little more expensive, check out SH Figuarts. These figures offer better likeness and superior articulation.
And if you wanna go even more expensive, check out Hot Toys. They basically exist only to pump out high quality Marvel, Star Wars, and DC, and occasionally some other licenses. 1/6 scale (12 inch) figures. Be warned, these are $200+ most of the time.

I'm not a fan of the movie figures, (I buy Hot Toys for that) so I'd go with ANAD Spidey. I like the Pizza Spidey mold, though it's not without it's flaws.
If you want maximum articulation, I suggest you consider getting the SH Figuarts Homecoming Spider-Man. Amazon will likely have some of the standard release for about $50 about a month after it releases in Asia, and it's only $10 more than you'd spend on one of the ML two packs.
Typically people have the common sense to realize that 1, 2, and 3 come before 4, so it only makes logical sense to play the games in that order.
For DOFP, they didn't tease Wolverine until the movie came out on Blu-Ray. Could be that there's still a chance Hot Toys does Logan.

No, the only thing inside the arm is the other end of the wrist joint.
I don't think you even need pliers to do it. Just place the hand with the broken bit in it, and squeeze the end that covers the wrist joint, and pull. That's how I did it.
No matter how you approach it, just be careful with the sleeve, of course.

Same peg broke for me too. Just grab some pliers and pull that shit out.
I haven't figured out how to remove the bit inside the hand though.

I don't know if there are any Potter fans here, but I figure I'd post this up in case there are. Star Ace does an abysmal job of advertising that they've got the rights to make 1/6 Harry Potter figures, so this might be news to some of you. I'm really looking forward to getting this figure, big Harry Potter fan here. EDIT: These are literally the only pictures of the final figure, by the way. It's been out for about 2 weeks judging by ebay auctions. Michael's got a great scoop here.
EDIT: I posted this in r/actionfigures, and I forgot to edit it.
And I guess Harry Potter collectibles aren't a cool thing to post in r/HarryPotter, judging by the down votes.

WRITING.TITLE: Review and photos of Harry Potter Teenage 1/6th scale action figure

WRITING.TEXT: He's gonna give Taft a run for his money.
The paint on this is soooo much more impressive than the paint on it's 1/6 counterpart. I got the rerelease version of the 1/6 at the start of the year, and this just blows it away!

WRITING.TEXT:
Eh, that doesn't mean they can't recast the part.
To be honest, just based off the name I had no idea she was a recurring character until Kate showed up. I was expecting Melissa, based on the character's name.
I guess I shouldn't expect too much from the show that had Fred Armisen play Obama as long as he did, when Jay Pharoah was literally right there.

Yeah, she's Hispanic.
Here's the first thing that comes up if you Google it:
"In short, Hispanic focuses on Spanish-speaking origin. This means Spain is included, but Brazil is not because Brazilians speak Portuguese. Latino refers to people of Latin American origin. This includes Brazil and excludes Spain."

So they finally have a Hispanic cast member on the show, and she doesn't get to play the Hispanic character.
Okay, then.
they already did that in MI:2
